explanation: The report is not correct. Under MISRA R2.2 an operation is dead only if its removal would not affect program behaviour. The mhd_assert call cannot be assumed to be pure/no-op for all builds or all inputs: assertion implementations commonly perform diagnostics or abort on failure, and removing the call would change behaviour in failure/error cases. Even if the condition is expected to hold in the normal case, the assertion documents and enforces an invariant and can affect behaviour for out‑of‑spec inputs (or when compiled with diagnostics enabled). The agent’s argument only considers the “normal” case and ignores error cases and possible side‑effects of mhd_assert, so it does not meet the criterion for dead code. Therefore the claimed violation of MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 is incorrect.
